tag.display: Example bundle for COFE document header

name: COFE-Document-Bundle-1
description: An NHS Digital Bundle Profile to represent a container to collect a combination of the COFE Document resources.

element.short: A container that has a Composition resource as the first resource in the bundle, followed by a series of other resources, referenced from the Composition resource.
element.definition: A container for a collection of resources.

constraint.human: entry.search only when a search
total only when a search or history
FullUrl must be unique in a bundle, or else entries with the same fullUrl must have different meta.versionId
constraint.xpath: count(for $entry in f:entry[f:resource] return $entry[count(parent::f:Bundle/f:entry[f:fullUrl/@value=$entry/f:fullUrl/@value and ((not(f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value) and not($entry/f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value)) or f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value=$entry/f:resource/*/f:meta/f:versionId/@value)])!=1])=0

extension.valueString: entry.request.empty() or type = 'batch' or type = 'transaction' or type = 'history'

constraint.human: entry.request only for some types of bundles
entry.response only for some types of bundles
entry.transaction when (and only when) a transaction
entry.transactionResponse when (and only when) a transaction-response

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Indicates the purpose of this bundle - how it was intended to be used.
element.comments: It's possible to use a bundle for other purposes (e.g. a document can be accepted as a transaction). This is primarily defined so that there can be specific rules for some of the bundle types.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle- how it was intended to be used

element.short: If search, the total number of matches
element.definition: If a set of search matches, this is the total number of matches for the search (as opposed to the number of results in this bundle).
element.comments: Only used if the bundle is a search result set.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.name: link
element.definition: A series of links that provide context to this bundle.

element.definition: An entry in a bundle resource - will either contain a resource, or information about a resource (transactions and history only).

element.short: Absolute URL for resource (server address, or UUID/OID)
element.definition: The Absolute URL for the resource. This must be provided for all resources. The fullUrl SHALL not disagree with the id in the resource. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource.
element.comments: fullUrl may not be [unique in the context of a resource](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/bundle.html#bundle-unique). Note that since [FHIR resources do not need to be served through the FHIR API](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/references.html), the absolute URL may not end with the logical id of the resource (Resource.id), but if the fullUrl does look like a RESTful server URL (e.g. meets the [regex](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/references.html#regex), then it SHALL end with the Resource.id.

element.short: match | include | outcome - why this is in the result set
element.definition: Why this entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement.
element.comments: There is only one mode. In some corner cases, a resource may be included because it is both a match and an include. In these circumstances, 'match' takes precedence.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement.

element.definition: When searching, the server's search ranking score for the entry.
element.comments: Servers are not required to return a ranking score. 1 is most relevant, and 0 is least relevant. Often, search results are sorted by score, but the client may specify a different sort order.

binding.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line).

element.short: URL for HTTP equivalent of this entry
element.definition: The URL for this entry, relative to the root (the address to which the request is posted).
element.comments: E.g. for a Patient Create, the method would be "POST" and the URL would be "Patient". For a Patient Update, the method would be PUT, and the URL would be "Patient/[id]".

element.comments: Note: This is intended for precisely observed times, typically system logs etc., and not human-reported times - for them, see date and dateTime below. Time zone is always required

element.definition: The etag for the resource, it the operation for the entry produced a versioned resource.
element.comments: This has to match the version id in the header if a resource is included.

element.definition: The date/time that the resource was modified on the server.
element.comments: This has to match the same time in the meta header if a resource is included.

element.definition: XML Digital Signature - base64 encoded.
element.comments: This is base 64 encoded to address issues with json/xml.
element.requirements: This element allows capturing signatures on documents. It also allows signatures on messages, transactions or even query responses. It may support content-authentication, non-repudiation or other business cases. This is primarily relevant where the bundle may travel through multiple hops or via other mechanisms where HTTPS non-repudiation is insufficient.

element.short: Indication of the reason the entity signed the object(s)
element.definition: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.
element.comments: Examples include attesting to: authorship, correct transcription, and witness of specific event. Also known as a "Commitment Type Indication".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: An indication of the reason that an entity signed the object

mapping.map: CE/CNE/CWE subset one of the sets of component 1-3 or 4-6

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comments: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should de-reference to some definition that establish the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comments: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.comments: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.comments: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comments: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.definition: When the digital signature was signed.
element.comments: This should agree with the information in the signature.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the person that signed the certificate (e.g. the signature used their private key).
element.comments: This should agree with the information in the signature.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The technical format of the signature
element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jwt for JWT, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature.
element.comments: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.short: The actual signature content (XML DigSig. JWT, picture, etc.)
element.definition: The base64 encoding of the Signature content.
element.comments: Where the signature type is an XML DigSig, the signed content is a FHIR Resource(s), the signature is of the XML form of the Resource(s) using  XML-Signature (XMLDIG) "Detached Signature" form.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
